Can be done electronically.
And.

Integrated into their own systems so they could more easily share technical documents to make the development process of the aircraft much faster.

So if I remember correctly, they saved roughly 50% of the time from the first time they started the product until the airplane could be produced because of the tight integration with the suppliers and the additional knowledge each of those suppliers could bring in.

And it was a win win situation for both because the suppliers could apply their best practices and still make sure they're going to be the supplier of chair of choice when it actually comes to building the whole airplane.
Now.
A different bus work was project based supply chain management.
One of the ideas we have is that the supply chain is flexible.
And we're using the supply chain only on a project basis, and a project usually means like development of a single product.
So the key identifiers for that kind of thing is it's user usually started by an idea like I want to build a certain product.
It tries to be a best of Reed approach, so once I said like I want to build this kind of product, I'm searching for the best suppliers I can get to help me build my product.
And the duration of the Supply chain.
Is limited to the duration of the project, meaning as long as I'm producing the product.
Benefits.
You have limited exposure both ways.
The suppliers don't rely on one large customer to buy everything they're building, and the customer doesn't rely on just one supplier.
If something goes wrong.
A lot of things are going wrong.
For the organization.

Are not able to fulfill the order an OEM has been given.

Working together with them to try and fulfill the order is a win win situation for both of you, because if you don't collaborate, neither of you will get the order.

And it allows you to have extended capabilities because.

Experience so far.

On the other hand, also to a business side, like if you're jointly developing a product.
With your suppliers who has the intellectual property on what?

They do it manually.
On the other hand.

We provide a couple of modules which the organizations can use.

Behaved like how did all the participants in the project do an?

We are actually going to use best practices, so once the platform is installed.

It provides you with an API for integration of external software and here.

And we made it available as open source, so the cost, at least for the license, is not so high.
Obviously a platform like that will need consulting and training.
Which local partners can deliver?
But that's that part now.

From a business side.
Virtual organization are virtually unknown like.
They don't exist like the concept isn't known.
Let alone organization.
Technologies or technology in general is not widely adopted, which provides a problem if you're talking about an ICT solution for a supply chain.
We realized the lots of teaching and training is necessary, which also means that you need to work with local partners that can teach and train into the hand holding an there.
Again, we come into a situation which is different between countries, but in some countries SMS are a very resilient to outside consulting.

Which means that we are unaware how to get to those organizations, because if something needs training and teaching and they don't want to have consultants come in and just use the platform, it's not going to be much use for them, so again.
Challenge.
And the concept of a virtual organization.

It's hard to understand in the current business climate because there are still in fixed structures, fixed supply lines, and they're not thinking integrated, and they're not seeing opportunity opportunities which come by looking for suppliers which are actually not in my local region, but maybe somewhere else.
It's changing, but that is the situation we have been faced with so far and from a technology point of view.
Integration of multiple frameworks is hard.
